The accidental release prevention and emergency response policies at the stationary source [40 CFR 68.155(a)]:

ALTIVIA Oxide Chemicals, LLC  (ALTIVIA) is committed to the safety of their workers and the public, and to the preservation of the environment, through the prevention of accidental releases of hazardous substances. ALTIVIA implements reasonable controls to prevent foreseeable releases of hazardous substances. In the event of a significant accidental release, our trained Emergency Response personnel will respond to control and contain such releases. ALTIVIA evaluates each situation , evacuates workers as necessary, and contacts the local fire department to control and contain the release and to prevent and/or reduce the consequences of the release. ALTIVIA, the local emergency planning committee (LEPC), and the fire department have established a program to warn the community if an accident occurs that could threaten the community.

The stationary source and regulated substances handled [40 CFR 68.155(b)]:

ALTIVIAs Crosby facility processes and stores Ethylene Oxide and Propylene Oxide in amounts greater than the RMP threshold, which includes the transportation of the two RMP-regulated chemicals via rail car.

The general accidental release prevention program and chemical-specific prevention steps [40 CFR 68.155(c)]:

ALTIVIA has a program in place to comply with the provisions of the accidental release prevention regulations under 40 CFR Part 68. The following sections briefly describe the elements of the existing release prevention program.

Process Safety Information [40 CFR Part 68.65]
ALTIVIA maintains a detailed record of process safety information that describes the chemical hazards, operating parameters and equipment designs associated with all processes.

Process Hazard Analysis [40 CFR Part 68.67]
ALTIVIA has established programs to help ensure that hazards associated with the various processes are identified and controlled. Within this program,

each process is systematically examined to identify hazards and ensure that adequate controls are in place to manage these hazards. ALTIVIA carries out these analyses using the HAZOP methodology. The studies are undertaken by a team of qualified personnel with expertise in engineering and process operations and are revalidated at a regular interval of 5 years. Any findings related to the hazard analysis are addressed in a timely manner.

Written Operating Procedures [40 CFR Part 68.69]
To ensure safe operations, ALTIVIA maintains detailed written operating procedures. These procedures address various modes of operation such as initial startup, normal operations, temporary operations, emergency shutdown, emergency operations and normal shutdown. The information is regularly reviewed and is readily accessible to operators involved in the processes.

Employee Training [40 CFR Part 68.71]
ALTIVIA has a training program in place to ensure that employees who are operating plant processes are competent in the applicable operating procedures. Refresher training is provided at least every three years and more frequently as needed.

Mechanical Integrity [40 CFR Part 68.73]
ALTIVIA carries out documented maintenance checks on process equipment to ensure proper operations. Inspected process equipment include pressure vessels, storage tanks, piping systems, pressure relief and vent systems, emergency shutdown systems, controls, and pumps. Maintenance operations are carried out by qualified personnel with previous training in maintenance practices. Furthermore, these personnel are offered specialized training as needed. Any equipment deficiencies identified by the maintenance checks are corrected in a safe and timely manner.

Management of Change [MOC] [40 CFR Part 68.75]
Written procedures are in place at ALTIVIA to manage changes in process chemicals, technology, equipment, and procedures. Facility operators or any other employee whose job tasks are affected by a modification i

n process conditions are promptly made aware of and offered training to deal with the modification(s).

Pre-Startup Safety Review [PSSR] [40 CFR Part 68.77]
Pre-start up safety reviews related to new processes and modifications to existing processes are conducted routinely at ALTIVIA. These reviews are conducted to confirm that construction, equipment, operating, and maintenance procedures are suitable for safe startup prior to placing equipment into operation.

Compliance Audits [40 CFR Part 68.79]
ALTIVIA conducts audits on a regular basis to determine whether the provisions set out under the US EPA RMP and OSHA PSM regulations are being implemented. These audits are conducted at least every 3 years and any corrective actions required as a result of the audits are undertaken in a prompt manner.

Incident Investigation [40 CFR Part 68.81]
ALTIVIA promptly investigates any incident that has resulted in, or could reasonably result in a catastrophic release of a regulated substance. These investigations are undertaken to identify the situation leading to the incident as well as any corrective actions to prevent the release from reoccurring. All reports are retained for a minimum period of 5 years.

Employee Participation [40 CFR Part 68.83]
ALTIVIA believes that Process Safety Management and accident prevention is a team effort. Employees are strongly encouraged to express their views concerning accident prevention issues and to recommend improvements. In addition, ALTIVIA employees have access to all information created as part of the facility's implementation of the RMP and PSM rules, including information resulting from Process Hazard Analyses in particular.

Hot Work Permit [40 CFR Part 68.85]
ALTIVIA has safe work practices in place to help ensure worker and process safety. Examples of these include control of the entry/presence/exit of support personnel, a lockout/tagout procedure, a procedure for safe removal of hazardous materials before process piping or equi

pment is opened, a hot work permit and a permit/procedure to ensure that adequate precautions are in place before entry into a confined space. These procedures, along with training of affected personnel, form a system to help ensure that operations and maintenance activities are performed safely.

Contractor Safety Program [40 CFR Part 68.87] 
ALTIVIA occasionally hires contractors to conduct specialized maintenance and construction activities. Prior to selecting a contractor, a thorough evaluation of the contractor's safety performance is carried out. ALTIVIA has a policy of informing the contractors of known potential hazards associated with the contractor's work and the corresponding processes. Contractors are also informed of all the procedures for emergency response in the event of an accidental release of a regulated substance.

The five-year accident history [40 CFR 68.155(d)]:

The Crosby site has had zero RMP reportable incidents in the previous five years.

The emergency response program [40 CFR 68.155(e)]:

In the event of an incident. ALTIVIA has an emergency response plan and employees are trained to respond in the event of an accidental release. The facility has a plan in place for evacuations, adequate first aid/medical treatment and notification procedures for local emergency response agencies. Responding employees are trained in the response procedures and take part in regular notification exercises and field or tabletop exercises. The facility also relies on the Crosby Fire Department when necessary to respond to chemical releases.

Planned changes to improve safety [40 CFR 68.155(f)]:

ALTIVIA completed a compliance audit in September 2023 of the PSM Program System used at the ALTIVIA Facilities and is prioritizing and addressing action items identified from the audit. ALTIVIA periodically reviews their safety systems to ensure a safe operation and is working to potentially expand their processes.

ALTIVIA has completed this report to provide the

public with information about our activities at this facility.  We believe that the many controls instituted to maintain a safe operation, and our commitment to continuous improvement that an incident affecting our employees or the surrounding area is unlikely to occur.
